sentences: Tema on paar minutit hiljaks jäänud.
Meie lähime paariks poiss ja tüdrukuna kohtingule.
See on ainult üks paljudest paariist.
context: In Estonian, 'paar' is a versatile word that can mean either 'couple' (when referring to two people in a relationship) or 'pair' (when referring to two items), and it can also mean 'a few' when used with numerals. The meaning depends on context - it can refer to romantic couples, pairs of objects like shoes or gloves, or indicate a small number of things.
